p: There is no guarantee that treating the host response will be effective, but we urgently need to find out. If a highly virulent and easily transmissible pandemic influenza virus emerges, it will spread rapidly throughout the world, overwhelming healthcare systems everywhere. In the absence of pandemic vaccines and effective antiviral treatments, the only way Indian physicians might reduce pandemic mortality will be to treat seriously ill patients with easily administered inexpensive generic drugs that are already available and that modify the host response to infection. In countries like India, the challenge of the next pandemic must make this the central element of preparedness planning.
